Message:
was not only a witch,
but an orphan of war just like me.
Until now, she had been
helping people she came across
in her travels.

When I asked how
she was helping them,

Aura handed me a bracelet
inset with a red gemstone.

“Rustica, what is it
that you wish for?”

As the words left my lips,
the bracelet emitted
the same golden light as before,
transforming into a rapier.

By sacrificing a piece of jewelry
worn on her body
for an extended period of time,
she could grant any wish.
That was Aura’s power.

It was also why Aura
was covered head to toe in
jangling jewelry of all sorts.

I called her a bagworm,
only to get a right hook
to the face in response.

“My power alone isn’t enough
to save everyone.
But, that doesn’t mean
I shouldn’t still try my best
to help people, at least.”

“If the ones I help
reach out their hands
to others too some day...”

Does this self-sacrificing softie
not have a hint of skepticism
in that brain of hers?

Despite her good intentions,
all she truly seemed to attract
were jewel-hungry thieves.

Good grief...
She’s so naïve, there’s no way
I can leave her alone...

Those who learn of Aura’s power
all get overtaken with greed
sooner or later.
That’s what I’d decided...
